Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Bravo \Bra"vo\, interj. [It. See {Brave}.] Well done! excellent! an exclamation expressive of applause. [1913 Webster] ||

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bravo \Bra"vo\, n.; pl. {Bravoes}. [I. See {Brave}, a.] A daring villain; a bandit; one who sets law at defiance; a professional assassin or murderer. [1913 Webster]
Safe from detection, seize the unwary prey. And stab, like bravoes, all who come this way. --Churchill. [1913 Webster]

bravo n 1: a murderer (especially one who kills a prominent political figure) who kills by a treacherous surprise attack and often is hired to do the deed; "his assassins were hunted down like animals"; "assassinators of kings and emperors" [syn: {assassin}, {assassinator}] 2: a cry of approval as from an audience at the end of great performance v : applaud with shouts of `bravo' or `brava' [also: {bravoes} (pl)]
